data.title: DePatie-Freleng Cartoons, 1970-1980
data.text:
Go To DePatie-Freleng Cartoons, 1964-1969

Updated: March 8, 2002

NOTE: The DePatie-Freleng Cartoon Library is not currently licensed for broadcast in the United States, and has not been since 1999, when Cartoon Network aired it. Please visit www.cartoonnetwork.com and tell then you want to see the Pink Panther again!

Also, for more on The Pink Panther, including some neat historical trivia and an interview recently conducted with David H. DePatie, visit www.pinkpanther.com and click on "Classic".

Scratch A Tiger

Rel 1/28/70 - MPAA 22104 - Ant & Aardvark

Director: Hawley Pratt - Story: Irv Spector - Music: Doug Goodwin - Voices: John Byner, Marvin Miller - Animation: Art Leonardi, Manny Gould, Manny Perez, Warren Batchelder, Don Williams - Graphics: Dick Ung - Color: Tom O'Loughlin - Film Editor: Lee Gunther - Camera: John Burton Jr. - Production Supervision: Jim Foss - Production Coordinator: Harry Love

The following 32 Pink Panther cartoons were produced for the "All New Pink Panther Show" which aired on ABC from 1978-1979. All carry 1978 copyright dates and were also theatrically released by UA on dates indicated. Music, not credited, is primarily by Steve DePatie, with some cues by Doug Goodwin. These films are listed in MPAA Certificate order.
